title: Easy Chinese Corn Soup Recipe
description: This quick and satisfying Chinese corn soup is delicious and simple enough to make at home anytime for an easy lunch or dinner in just 15 minutes.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes Soup Recipes Vegetable Soup Recipes Easy Chinese Corn Soup 4.4 (101) 86 Reviews 10 Photos This quick and easy Chinese corn soup is so good that I never bother ordering it from restaurants anymore! Submitted by Liz Updated on July 14, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 10 10 10 10 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 15 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 (15 ounce) can cream style corn 1 (14.5 ounce) can low-sodium chicken broth 1 tablespoon cornstarch 2 tablespoons water 1 large egg, beaten Directions Combine corn and chicken broth in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Mix together cornstarch and water in a small bowl or cup; pour into the boiling corn soup, and continue cooking for about 2 minutes, or until thickened. Gradually add beaten egg while stirring the soup. Remove from heat and serve. I Made It Print 169 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 121 Calories 2g Fat 24g Carbs 5g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 121 % Daily Value * Total Fat 2g 2% Saturated Fat 1g 3% Cholesterol 48mg 16% Sodium 409mg 18% Total Carbohydrate 24g 9% Dietary Fiber 2g 5% Total Sugars 4g Protein 5g 10% Vitamin C 6mg 6% Calcium 11mg 1% Iron 1mg 4% Potassium 178mg 4% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Easy Chinese Corn Soup 01 of 10 Photo by  Ariel Burn 02 of 10 Photo by  dhojee 03/07/2022 The recipe was straightforward and simple enough to complete under 15 mins. Didn't tweak much except additional broth, an extra egg and some milk. Tasted pretty much like that from the restaurant. Kids liked it, we added a touch of black pepper, that gave it a little bit more zing. Next time I will try garnishing it wt scallions and adding more stuff like diced chicken. 03 of 10 Photo by  Cooking Daddy 02/05/2021 04 of 10 Photo by  Angie Esposito 01/16/2020 It is ok. Not very flavorful, alter a simple recipe with a simple corn and egg flavor. Possibly could use some spices. 05 of 10 Photo by  Zainub Khan 05/25/2015 quick easy and inexpensive! also tastes great too due to the simple flavours. would have added a little soya sauce/vinegar if i had some on hand but just added a little salt and chilli sauce instead. bought cream style corn by accident and now i know how to use it :) 06 of 10 Photo by  MadameMusings 05/24/2015 Perfect for a late night craving! Basic recipe would have been perfect but wanted to spice it up. Based on other reviews added: doubled chicken broth (Better than Bouillon paste), 1/2 cup rice wine (mirin), 2 tbsp. sesame oil, and seasoned with green onion and white pepper. 07 of 10 Photo by  lcji 03/23/2015 So simple and delicious and you can add your own little twist. I doubled the recipe and added a 1/2 tbsp of lite soy and some pepper. 08 of 10 Photo by  Ariel Burn 01/22/2015 This corn soup is brilliant! Use arrowroot powder instead of corn starch for a healthier version. You can also make your own chicken broth or replace with water. :) 09 of 10 Photo by  Rababeroni 03/04/2014 10 of 10 Photo by  Janice 02/16/2011 Yum! My Mom used to make this when I was growing up. I really love this soup! It's sweet, light, and creamy! Thanks for sharing! 1 You’ll Also Love Spinach and Leek White Bean Soup 476 Ratings Colene's Easy Tomato Vegetable Soup 48 Ratings Bean Soup with Kale 1,040 Ratings Minestrone Soup 113 Ratings Roasted Red Bell Pepper Soup 117 Ratings White Bean Soup 56 Ratings Sweet and Spicy Soup with Black-Eyed Peas and Sweet Potato 60 Ratings Loaded Black-Eyed Peas, Spinach, and Vegetable Soup 14 Ratings Bryan's Spicy Red Lentil Soup 103 Ratings Calico Wild Rice Soup 4 Ratings Chunky Vegetarian Vegetable Soup (Fast and Easy) 122 Ratings Chicken Chili Soup 145 Ratings Velvety Chicken Corn Soup 83 Ratings Butternut Squash-Sweet Potato Ginger Bisque 55 Ratings Spicy Red Bell Pepper Soup 91 Ratings Fat-Free Vegetable Soup 62 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Liz
instructions: Combine corn and chicken broth in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat.;Mix together cornstarch and water in a small bowl or cup; pour into the boiling corn soup, and continue cooking for about 2 minutes, or until thickened.;Gradually add beaten egg while stirring the soup. Remove from heat and serve.
